page.title: 03Access to Rhenigidale.
page.content: There are two means of access-by sea or by land.{By sea}to the landing place and{by land}via a footpath from Tarbert.{The footpath}from the Tarbert to Kyles road is clearly defined although in wet weather it can be very muddy, and zigzags over the S.E. shoulder of Trollamul. The path is not suitable for cyclists nor for people with vertigo as it drops quickly from a height of 280 m to sea level at one point. All supplies of groceries, animal feed, building materials etc. have to come in{by sea}on a 26 foot fishing boat and be landed at the natural stone jetty and carried to the houses. This is not a suitable arrangement as the jetty is exposed to the prevailing S.W. wind which often means that no matter the time of year, it is not possible to land anything, sometimes for days at a time.
